thread.title: Strictly Come Dancing's Kellie Bright talks about that emotional Foxtrot
thread.title_full: Strictly Come Dancing's Kellie Bright talks about that emotional Foxtrot

title: Strictly Come Dancing's Kellie Bright talks about that emotional Foxtrot
text:
Strictly Come Dancing's Kellie Bright talks about that emotional Foxtrot Strictly Come Dancing's Kellie Bright talks about that emotional Foxtrot 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Strictly Come Dancing’s Kellie Bright has spoken about her emotional Foxtrot from the weekend. She’s also revealed why she got upset following her performance. 
Talking to Zoe Ball on It Takes Two, she said: “Saturday was really special to me. No two ways about it, it meant a lot. Kellie and Kevin (BBC) 
“I had to really try and block everything out, while I was doing the dance, and it wasn’t until a bit later, [when] I read some texts from my family.. I got really upset. 
“It was just a lovely moment, and I’m really grateful to Kevin Clifton because he made that happen.” 
Kellie dedicated her foxtrot to her grandparents. 
She told Zoe: “It felt like a tribute to everyone’s nana and granddad, not just mine, and that was what was so lovely.” Some pictures from Saturday night ❤️ this was the most beautiful dance ever 💗💃 pic.twitter.com/iD3QzpAEgQ 
— Leah|#TeamBright♡ (@KellieBFan) October 19, 2015 
She said her mum found it ‘moving and emotional’, and added: “And honestly, wherever my nan and granddad are, they would have been beaming. My nan will just dine out, for the rest of eternity, on the fact that she was on Strictly Come Dancing – that’s it now!” Share article 
Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two is on weeknights at 6.30pm on BBC Two. Promoted Stories
